title: access nagios dashboard using default credentials in ** omon1.fpki.gov, 3.220.248.203**
content:
Summary:
when i performing recon on fpki.gov i found nagios dashboard in omon1.fpki.gov, 3.220.248.203 and i accessed it using default credentials
username: nagiosadmin
password : nagiosadmin
Steps To Reproduce:
visit these urls : https://omon1.fpki.gov/nagios/side.php https://3.220.248.203/nagios/side.php
he will ask to put your credentials in basic authentication enter these credentials username: nagiosadmin password : nagiosadmin
POC:
look at poc pic
Impact
attacker can make any action like an admin he has full control on your panal.
thanks , have a nice day :)
steps: Visit the URLs: https://omon1.fpki.gov/nagios/side.php or https://3.220.248.203/nagios/side.php
Enter the default credentials when prompted (username: nagiosadmin, password: nagiosadmin)
vuln_description: The Nagios dashboard on omon1.fpki.gov and 3.220.248.203 was accessible using default credentials (nagiosadmin/nagiosadmin), allowing full administrative control over the panel.
reason: The vulnerability involves no complex components or interactions. It is a straightforward case of default credentials being left unchanged, which is a common and well-known issue.

authnz_metadata.reasoning: The reported vulnerability involves accessing a Nagios dashboard using default credentials (nagiosadmin:nagiosadmin). This falls under AuthN/AuthZ bypass, as the methodology includes testing for unauthenticated access (step d). The detection method for AuthN bypass would involve substituting an unauthenticated session and verifying access. Here, the credentials are default, so an attacker bypasses proper authentication via known defaults. The methodology's step d (testing actions with unauthenticated sessions) would detect this if the system allows access with default credentials without requiring proper user authentication.
